snippet: Protests in southern Algeria turned violent over the weekend when the police clashed with demonstrators outside a base run by the American company Halliburton near the town of Ain Salah.
abstract: Protests against fracking for shale gas in southern Algeria become violent when police clash with demonstrators near base run by Halliburton.
lead_paragraph: Protests in southern Algeria turned violent over the weekend when the police clashed with demonstrators outside a base run by the American company Halliburton near the town of Ain Salah.

headline.main: Algeria: Violence Erupts at Protest Over Shale Gas Drilling Project
headline.print_headline: Algeria: Violence Erupts at Protest Over Shale Gas Drilling Project
